verses.roman:
uccāvaceṣu bhūteṣu
caran vāyur iveśvaraḥ
noccāvacatvaṁ bhajate
nirguṇatvād dhiyo guṇaiḥ

synonyms: ucca-avaceṣu—having higher or lower bodily forms; bhūteṣu—among the living entities; caran—behaving; vāyuḥ iva—exactly like the air; īśvaraḥ—the Supreme Lord; na—not; ucca-avacatvam—the quality of higher or lower grades of life; bhajate—accepts; nirguṇatvāt—because of being transcendental, above all material qualities; dhiyaḥ—generally; guṇaiḥ—by the modes of material nature.
translation: Like the air passing through different types of atmosphere, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, although appearing sometimes as a human being and sometimes as a lower animal, is always transcendental. Because He is above the material modes of nature, He is unaffected by higher and lower forms.

purport.content: The Supreme Personality of Godhead is the master of the material nature (mayādhyakṣeṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sacarācaram ). Paraṁ bhāvam ajānantaḥ: such a conclusion is reached by the unintelligent because they are unaware of the transcendental qualities of the Lord.
